fields.headline: Morrison seeks loan move
fields.bodyText: Clinton Morrison, whose goal helped earn the Republic of Ireland a Group Four point from their 1-1 draw in Switzerland, is to ask his Birmingham City manager Steve Bruce for a loan move as he seeks the first-team football required to further his international ambitions. Bruce has strengthened his forward line with the signing of Dwight Yorke from Blackburn Rovers. The reality for Morrison is that with £6.25m England international Emile Heskey, Mikael Forssell and now Yorke in the Birmingham squad, he has effectively dropped down the pecking order to fourth choice. A loan deal would mean that the 25-year-old Morrison would have to drop into the Coca-Cola Championship because with the transfer window closed, he is not allowed to join another Premiership club until it re-opens in January. Morrison said: "All I can keep doing is playing well for my country when selected and give Steve a problem. But I know between now and France next month [October 9] I need to get some matches under my belt because that is going to be a big game."
